This indicator determines whether an assessment item is an adaptive item.

Element Name: Assessment Item APIP Item Body XML
Definition: The item body contains the text, graphics, media objects, and interactions that describe the item's content and information about how it is structured. The body is presented by combining it with stylesheet information, either explicitly or implicitly using the default style rules of the delivery or authoring system. This element contains the appropriate XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification defining the various item body interactions.

Element Name: Assessment Item APIP Modal Feedback XML
Definition: Modal feedback is shown to the candidate directly following response processing. The value of an outcome variable is used in conjunction with the showHide and identifier attributes to determine whether or not the feedback is shown in a similar way to feedbackElement. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item APIP Outcome Declaration XML
Definition: Outcome variables are declared by outcome declarations. Their value is set either from a default given in the declaration itself or by a responseRule during response processing. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item APIP Response Declaration XML
Definition: Response declarations state what the response variables include. The response declaration may assign an optional correct response. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item APIP Response Processing Template URL
Definition: These templates are described using the processing language defined in IMS Global APIP specification and are distributed (in XML form) along with it. Delivery engines that support generalized response processing do not need to implement special mechanisms to support them as a template file can be parsed directly while processing the assessment item that refers to it. This element provides the URL for the template.

Element Name: Assessment Item APIP Response Processing XML
Definition: Response processing is the process by which the Delivery Engine assigns outcomes based on the learner's responses. The outcomes may be used to provide feedback to the learner Feedback is either provided immediately following the end of the learner's attempt or it is provided at some later time, perhaps as part of a summary report on the item session. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item APIP Template Declaration XML
Definition: Template declarations declare item variables that are to be used specifically for the purposes of cloning items. They can have their value set only during template processing. They are referred to within the item body in order to individualize the clone and possibly also within the response Processing rules if the cloning process affects the way the item is scored. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item APIP Template Processing XML
Definition: Template processing consists of one or more template rules that are followed by the cloning engine or delivery system in order to assign values to the template variables. Template processing is identical in form to responseProcessing except that the purpose is to assign values to template variables, not outcome variables. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.
The assessment item result formatted according to the IMS Global QTI Specification.
Usage Notes: See http://www.imsglobal.org/question/qtiv2p1/imsqti_resultv2p1.html#element10818

Definition: The position of this APIP Interaction in a sequence of interactions.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Associate Interaction XML
Definition: An associate interaction presents candidates with a number of choices and allows them to create associations between them. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Choice Interaction XML
Definition: The choice interaction presents a set of choices to the candidate. The candidate's task is to select one or more of the choices, up to a maximum of maxChoices. The interaction is always initialized with no choices selected. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Drawing Interaction XML
Definition: The drawing interaction allows the candidate to use a common set of drawing tools to modify a given graphical image (the canvas). It must be bound to a response variable with base-type file and single cardinality. The result is a file in the same format as the original image. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body End Attempt Interaction XML
Definition: The end attempt interaction is a special type of interaction which allows item authors to provide the candidate with control over the way in which the candidate terminates an attempt. The candidate can use the interaction to terminate the attempt (triggering response processing) immediately, typically to request a hint. It must be bound to a response variable with base-type boolean and single cardinality. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Extended Text Interaction XML
Definition: An extended text interaction allows the candidate to enter an extended amount of text. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Gap Match Interaction XML
Definition: A gap match interaction contains a number gaps that the candidate can fill from an associated set of choices. The candidate must be able to review the content with the gaps filled in context, as indicated by their choices. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Graphic Gap Match Interaction XML
Definition: A graphic gap-match interaction is a graphical interaction with a set of gaps that are defined as areas (hotspots) of the graphic image and an additional set of gap choices that are defined outside the image. The candidate must associate the gap choices with the gaps in the image and be able to review the image with the gaps filled in context, as indicated by their choices. Care should be taken when designing these interactions to ensure that the gaps in the image are a suitable size to receive the required gap choices. It must be clear to the candidate which hotspot each choice has been associated with. When associated, choices must appear wholly inside the gaps if at all possible and, where overlaps are required, should not hide each other completely. If the candidate indicates the association by positioning the choice over the gap (e.g., drag and drop) the system should 'snap' it to the nearest position that satisfies these requirements. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Graphic Order Interaction XML
Definition: A graphic order interaction is a graphic interaction with a corresponding set of choices that are defined as areas of the graphic image. The candidate's task is to impose an ordering on the areas (hotspots). The order hotspot interaction should only be used when the spatial relationship of the choices with respect to each other (as represented by the graphic image) is important to the needs of the item. Otherwise, orderInteraction should be used instead with separate material for each option. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Hot Spot Interaction XML
Definition: A hotspot interaction is a graphical interaction with a corresponding set of choices that are defined as areas of the graphic image. The candidate's task is to select one or more of the areas (hotspots). The hotspot interaction should only be used when the spatial relationship of the choices with respect to each other (as represented by the graphic image) is important to the needs of the item. Otherwise, choiceInteraction should be used instead with separate material for each option. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Hottext Interaction XML
Definition: The hottext interaction presents a set of choices to the candidate represented as selectable runs of text embedded within a surrounding context, such as a simple passage of text. Like choiceInteraction, the candidate's task is to select one or more of the choices, up to a maximum of maxChoices. The interaction is initialized from the defaultValue of the associated response variable, a NULL value indicating that no choices are selected (the usual case). The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Inline Choice Interaction XML
Definition: A inline choice is an inline interaction that presents the user with a set of choices, each of which is a simple piece of text. The candidate's task is to select one of the choices. Unlike the Choice Interaction, the delivery engine must allow the candidate to review their choice within the context of the surrounding text.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Match Interaction XML
Definition: A match interaction presents candidates with two sets of choices and allows them to create associates between pairs of choices in the two sets, but not between pairs of choices in the same set. Further restrictions can still be placed on the allowable associations using the matchMax attribute of the choices. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Media Interaction XML
Definition: The media interaction allows more control over the way the candidate interacts with a time-based media object and allows the number of times the media object was experienced to be reported in the value of the associated response variable, which must be of base-type integer and single cardinality. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Order Interaction XML
Definition: In an order interaction the candidate's task is to reorder the choices, the order in which the choices are displayed initially is significant. By default the candidate's task is to order all of the choices but a subset of the choices can be requested using the maxChoices and minChoices attributes. When specified the candidate must select a subset of the choices and impose an ordering on them. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Position Object Interaction XML
Definition: The position object interaction consists of a single image which must be positioned on another graphic image (the stage) by the candidate. Like selectPointInteraction, the associated response may have an areaMapping that scores the response on the basis of comparing it against predefined areas but the delivery engine must not indicate these areas of the stage. Only the actual position(s) selected by the candidate shall be indicated. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Select Point Interaction
Definition: A graphic associate interaction is a graphic interaction with a corresponding set of choices that are defined as areas of the graphic image. The candidate's task is to associate the areas (hotspots) with each other. The graphic associate interaction should only be used when the graphical relationship of the choices with respect to each other (as represented by the graphic image) is important to the needs of the item. Otherwise, associateInteraction should be used instead with separate Material for each option. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Select Point Interaction XML
Definition: Like hotspotInteraction, a select point interaction is a graphic interaction. The candidate's task is to select one or more points. The associated response may have an areaMapping that scores the response on the basis of comparing it against predefined areas but the delivery engine must not indicate these areas of the image. Only the actual point(s) selected by the candidate shall be indicated. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Slider Interaction XML
Definition: The slider interaction presents the candidate with a control for selecting a numerical value between a lower and upper bound. It must be bound to a response variable with single cardinality with a base-type of either integer or float. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Text Entry Interaction XML
Definition: A textEntry interaction obtains a simple piece of text from the candidate. Like inlineChoiceInteraction, the delivery engine must allow the candidate to review their choice within the context of the surrounding text. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.

Element Name: Assessment Item Body Upload Interaction XML
Definition: The upload interaction allows the candidate to upload a pre-prepared file representing their response. It must be bound to a response variable with base-type file and single cardinality. The XML from the IMS Global APIP Specification would be included.
The assessment item body interaction type as defined by IMS Global specifications.

Definition: The name of the Assessment Asset.

Specifies a predominant type of assessment asset represented by the Learning Resource. Assessment assets represent any content used to compose an assessment item, is referenced by an item but not part of the item content itself, or is content that is included as part of a section within an assessment form. Assets can be static content such as art work or dynamic assets such as calculators.

Usage Notes: Used by states in reporting Kindergarten Entry Assessment (KEA) results as defined for some federal grant programs.
For each domain used by the state, the state would provide:
- The total number of children who participated in the KEA for each domain
- The number of children who participated in the KEA for each domain AND was at or above what the state defines as “ready” for kindergarten for that domain.

The counts may be calculated using unit-level data defined for Assessment Subtest (scoring method and what is being measured, e.g. the Domain), related Assessment Performance Levels (e.g. "Ready"), related to each student Assessment Result.

Definition: A feedback message designed to be reported with the assessment performance level.
If this score is preliminary, then this attribute value should be set. Preliminary scores may be provided for early use by the assessment program or user while final scoring is occurring.

A meaningful raw score, derived score, or statistical expression of the performance of a person on an assessment. The type of result is indicated by the Assessment Score Metric Type element. The results can be expressed as a number, percentile, range, level, etc. The score relates to all scored items or a sub test scoring one aspect of performance on the test. This value may or may not correspond to one or more Performance Levels.

Usage Notes: Information for interpreting the score is defined by elements in the related Assessment Subtest entity. This includes the minimum, maximum, and optimal values for the measurement. Assessment Subtest defines information for scoring an Assessment Form, which may be for the entire assessment or one aspect of evaluation. The Assessment Subtest may in turn be associated with one or more content standards using the Learning Standard Item Association entity.

Definition: The data type of the assessment result score value.

String - String
Usage Notes: An Assessment Result in CEDS may apply to an entire assessment or one aspect of evaluation as defined in the related “subtest” entity. The Assessment Result entity is repeatable, so there could be multiple Assessment Result Score Values each using a different Assessment Result Data Type, and each of these score values may be associated with one or more Assessment Performance Level(s).

Definition: Indicates the purpose for which this assessment score instance was recorded.
Option Set:
Initial - An initial assessment score instance.
Reliability - An assessment score instance recorded as a measure of reliability
Resolution - An assessment score instance recorded after resolution of scoring or data issues.
Backread - An assessment score recorded to determine whether or not each individual scorer is correctly applying the scoring guide to student responses.
Final - The final assessment score instance.

Definition: Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the resistance pressure of Braille display pins.
Format: Numeric - up to 4 digits after decimal place

Definition: Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the grade of Braille to use when using a Braille display.
Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile what textual properties to mark when using a Braille display.
Option Set:
Highlight - Highlight
Bold - Bold
Underline - Underline
Italic - Italic
Strikeout - Strikeout
Color - Color

Element Name: Assessment Need Braille Status Cell Type
Definition: Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the preferred presence or location of a Braille display status cell.
Option Set:
Off - Off
Left - Left
Right - Right

Definition: Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the Access for All (AfA) preference to invert the foreground and background Colors.

Element Name: Assessment Need Line Reader Highlight Color
Definition: The color defined as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile to be used to highlight the point of line reader activity i.e. the line being read.
Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the characteristics of presentation for a hyperlink when using a screen reader.
Option Set:
SpeakLink - Speak link
DifferentVoice - Different voice
SoundEffect - Sound effect
None - None

Definition: Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the preferred magnification of the screen as a factor of a screen’s original size.
Format: Numeric - up to 4 digits after decimal place

Definition: Specifies as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the type of masks the user is able to create to cover portions of the question until needed.
Option Set:
CustomMask - Custom mask
AnswerMask - Answer mask

Definition: Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the pitch of a speech synthesizer.
Format: Numeric - up to 4 digits after decimal place

Element Name: Assessment Need Read at Start Preference
Definition: Used as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile to define if the spoken play-back should commence from the start of a recording or not.
Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the type of signing preferred by the user.
Option Set:
ASL - American Sign Language
SignedEnglish - Signed English

Definition: The URI of the sound file that is to be played to the user as an expression of encouragement when Masking is specified as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile. It is left to the system to determine when to play this audio file.
Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the rate of speech of a speech synthesizer.
Format: Integer - greater than or equal to 0

Element Name: Assessment Need Spoken Source Preference Type
Definition: Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the preferred spoken audio form.
Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the volume of a speech synthesizer.
Format: Numeric - up to 4 digits after decimal place

Definition: The text string that is to be displayed to the user as an expression of encouragement when Masking is specified as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile. It is left to the system to determine when to display this string.
Defines as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile the rating for the collection of Access for All (AfA) needs and preferences.
Option Set:
Required - Required
Preferred - Preferred
OptionallyUse - Optionally use
Prohibited - Prohibited

Definition: This is the preferred Background color for screen enhancement defined as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile.
This is the preferred Foreground color for screen enhancement defined as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile.
Defines the user preferences for white spacing in lines, words and characters as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile.
Option Set:
Line - Line
Word - Word
Character - Character

Definition: This is the preferred color for the overlay for screen enhancement defined as part of an Assessment Personal Needs Profile.

Element Name: Assessment Session Scheduled End Date Time
Definition: Date and time the assessment is scheduled to end.

Element Name: Assessment Session Actual Start Date Time
Definition: Date and time the assessment actually began.
Usage Notes: When associated to an assessment session this is the actual start date and time. When associated to an individual taking an assessment, this is the actual date and time when the individual started.

Element Name: Assessment Session Actual End Date Time
Definition: Date and time the assessment actually ended.
Change Notes: Adding usage note to clarify that exit dates are inclusive, i.e. the dates represent the last day that the person was enrolled, participated, or received services, not the day after.
Usage Notes: When associated to an assessment session this is the actual end date and time. When associated to an individual taking an assessment, this is the actual date and time when the individual finished.

Change Notes: Update element "Program Type:" add the "Title I" option to the set to support EDFacts.

Definition: The title assigned to the achievement.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: A description of the achievement.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: An alias for the credential, which may include acronyms, alpha-numeric notations, and other forms of name abbreviations in common use such as PhD, MA, and BA.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: An alphanumeric identifier of a version of the credential being described that is unique within the organizational context.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The system that defines the categories of credential or achievement used in Credential Category Type.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person. The new wording of the element definition makes it clearer that this entity is a credential definition, not a credential assertion.
Usage Notes: This element recognizes formal adoption of categories for the Achievement Category Type to aid in comparability of data when a formally adopted vocabulary is used.

Definition: A category for defining a competency or qualification, achievement, personal or organizational quality, experience, attribute, or aspect of an identity typically used to indicate suitability.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person. The new wording of the element definition makes it clearer that this entity is a credential definition, not a credential assertion.
Usage Notes: Categories could include "Competency Mastered", "Competency Retained", "Course Completed", "Level Completed", "Certificate Earned", "Diploma Earned", "License Earned", "License Endorsement Earned", "Participation", "Academic Honor", "Non-Academic Honor", etc. (This element supports an emerging use case, therefore a complete set of options are not known. Future CEDS versions may define an Achievement Type element when a fixed option set can be compiled.) Note: The Achievement entity is most valuable when linked to a specific competency set that defined the learning standards related to the achievement.(SEE "Achievement Category System")

Definition: The status of the credential offered by a credentialing organization.
Option Set:
Active - Active
Deprecated - Deprecated
Probationary - Probationary
Superseded - Superseded
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The intended type of application of the credential by the holder.
Option Set:
GeneralEducation - General Education
JobOrCareerPreparation - Job/Career Preparation
MidCareer - Mid-Career Level
PriorExperience - Prior Learning Experience
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The method used to conduct the assessment being referenced.
Option Set:
Artifact - Artifact
Exam - Exam
Performance - Performance
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The criteria for competency-based completion of the achievement/award.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) for the unique address of a web page describing the competency-based completion criteria for the achievement/award.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The estimated amount of time in minutes it will take to earn the credential.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The minimum amount of time in minutes it will take to earn the described credential.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The maximum amount of time in minutes it will take to earn the described credential.

Definition: The minimum allowed age in years at which a person is eligible for the credential.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) class identifier for an industry associated with the credential.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: A resource describing the means by which someone can verify whether a credential has been attained by a person.
Option Set:
BadgeClaim - Badge Claim

Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The geo-political region in which the credential is applicable.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: A geo-political region in which the credential does not apply.

Usage Notes: http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#polygon

Definition: Keywords or key phrases describing aspects of a credential considered useful for its discovery.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: Description of the methods used to evaluate the validity and reliability of a credential earned by a person.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.

Definition: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code associated with an individual's employment.
The career cluster that defines the industry or occupational focus which may be associated with a career pathways program, plan of study, or course.
Option Set:
01 - Agriculture, Food & Natural Resources
02 - Architecture & Construction
03 - Arts, A/V Technology & Communications
04 - Business Management & Administration
05 - Education & Training
06 - Finance
07 - Government & Public Administration
08 - Health Science

10 - Human Services

16 - Transportation, Distribution & Logistics
Usage Notes: Options from O*NET OnLine an application that was created for the general public to provide broad access to the O*NET database of occupational information. O*NET OnLine offers a variety of search options and occupational data, while My Next Move is a streamlined application for students and job seekers. Both applications were developed for the U.S. Department of Labor by the National Center for O*NET Development. See onetonline.org for more information.

Definition: A six-digit code in the form xx.xxxx that identifies instructional program specialties within educational institutions.
Use Case / Connection:
K-12 -> High School Feedback Report
Postsecondary Education -> Complete College America
Postsecondary Education -> IPEDS
Postsecondary Education -> Transition

Definition: A network-resolvable Uniform Resource Locator (URL) pointing to the authoritative reference for the competency definition.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: An Identifier MAY be a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) / Globally Unique Identifier (GUID), i.e.128-bit unique identifiers generated according to the algorithms and encoding standards of RFC 4122.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item URL, Competency Item URL

Definition: The O*NET-SOC taxonomy defines the set of occupations across the world of work based on the Standard Occupational Classification.
Usage Notes: https://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy/2010/data_coll.html

Definition: The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) for the unique address of an image representing an award or badge associated with the achievement.
Usage Notes: Typical use is for online display of a badge image.

Definition: Effective date of the content of a credential definition.
Change Notes: New element to reflect the date on which a Credential Definition became effective. Based on CE term ceterms:dateEffective. Note: This is the date the content/definition of the credential became effective, not necessarily the date that one or more credentialing organizations began offering the credential.
Usage Notes: This is the date the content/definition of the credential became effective, not necessarily the date that one or more credentialing organizations began offering the credential.

Change Notes: This new element "CTDL Audience Level Type" supports alignment to the categories defined in the Credential Engine's Credential Transparency Description Language (CTDL). It is similar to "PESC Award Level Type" and "Academic Award Level Conferred" but uses a different controlled vocabulary.
Usage Notes: This is similar to "PESC Award Level Type" and "Academic Award Level Conferred" but uses a different controlled vocabulary. See https://credreg.net/ctdl/terms/Credential#AudienceLevel.

Definition: A globally unique identifier by which the creator/owner/provider of a credential recognizes the achievement in transactions with the external environment.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Credential" to "Credential Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "credential assertion" awarded to a person rather than what it is, i.e. a definition of a credential that could be awarded to any person.
Usage Notes: CEDS "Identifier" elements reflect the intent of the XSD:Token format, i.e. a string in which carriage return, line feed, and tab characters have been removed as well as any internal sequences of two or more spaces and any leading or trailing spaces. An Identifier MAY be a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) / Globally Unique Identifier (GUID), i.e.128-bit unique identifiers generated according to the algorithms and encoding standards of RFC 4122.

Definition: A coding scheme that is used for identification and record-keeping purposes by a credentialing organization to refer to an achievement.
Option Set:
CTID - Credential Transparency Identifier
URI - Uniform Resource Identifier
URL - Uniform Resource Locator
URN - Uniform Resource Name
UUID - Universally Unique Identifier
ARK - Archival Resource Key
DOI - Digital Document Identifier
INFO - INFO URI Scheme
Change Notes: Update element "Program Type:" add the "Title I" option to the set to support EDFacts.

Definition: A coding scheme that is used for identification and record-keeping purposes by schools, social services, or other agencies to refer to an organization.
Option Set:
School - School-assigned number
ACT - College Board/ACT program code set of PK-grade 12 institutions
LEA - Local Education Agency assigned number
SEA - State Education Agency assigned number
NCES - National Center for Education Statistics assigned number
FEIN - Federal employer identification number
DUNS - Dun and Bradstreet number
OtherFederal - Other federally assigned number
LicenseNumber - License Number
Other - Other
Use Case / Connection: Early Learning -> Program Quality
Change Notes: The proposed "Credential Offered" entity requires at minimum the OrganizationId, Credential(Definition)Id, a "Start Date" and "End Date". Existing start and end date elements in CEDS are contextualized. This proposes adding a normalized elements that could be reused for future additions to CEDS. Added "Licence Number" option. Added DES context "Program Identifier, Organization Identifier, Organization Identifier System" to K12 > LEA > Programs and Services.

Definition: A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to an organization by a school, school system, a state, or other agency or entity.
Use Case / Connection: Early Learning -> Program Quality
Usage Notes: CEDS "Identifier" elements reflect the intent of the XSD:Token format, i.e. a string in which carriage return, line feed, and tab characters have been removed as well as any internal sequences of two or more spaces and any leading or trailing spaces.

An Identifier MAY be a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) / Globally Unique Identifier (GUID), i.e.128-bit unique identifiers generated according to the algorithms and encoding standards of RFC 4122.

Definition: The last date a credential was offered.
Change Notes: The proposed "Credential Offered" entity requires, at minimum, the OrganizationId, Credential(Definition)Id, Start Date, and End Date. Existing start and end date elements in CEDS are contextualized. This proposes adding normalized elements that could be reused for future additions to CEDS.
Usage Notes: All CEDS Exit and End Dates represent the last day of the date range specified, such as the last day that a person was enrolled, participated, or received services.

Definition: The first date a credential was offered.
Change Notes: The proposed "Credential Offered" entity requires, at minimum, the OrganizationId, Credential(Definition)Id, Start Date, and End Date. Existing start and end date elements in CEDS are contextualized. This proposes adding normalized elements that could be reused for future additions to CEDS.

School Readiness

K-12 -> LEA-to-LEA Student Record Exchange

Definition: A description of a credential that reduced the time or cost of attaining this credential.
A URL that resolves to information about a credential that reduced the time or cost of attaining this credential.
The date on which the achievement was conferred.
Change Notes: Elements for Credential Award were incorrectly included in Credential (Definition). Proposed corrections: 1. Remove "Credential Start Date" and "Credential End Date" from DES under "Credential" ( keep under Credential Award) 2. Rename "Credential Start Date" to "Credential Award Start Date" 3. Rename " Credential End Date" to "Credential Award End Date"
Usage Notes: Diploma or Credential Award Date is the same concept but used when only month and year are known or needed.

Definition: The date, if any, on which the award or achievement expires or requires renewal.
Change Notes: Elements for Credential Award were incorrectly included in Credential (Definition). Proposed corrections: 1. Remove "Credential Start Date" and "Credential End Date" from DES under "Credential" ( keep under Credential Award) 2. Rename "Credential Start Date" to "Credential Award Start Date" 3. Rename " Credential End Date" to "Credential Award End Date" Adding usage note to clarify that exit dates are inclusive, i.e. the dates represent the last day that the person was enrolled, participated, or received services, not the day after.
Usage Notes: All CEDS Exit and End Dates represent the last day of the date range specified, such as the last day that a person was enrolled, participated, or received services.

Definition: The date on which the person's requirements for earning a credential were met or completed.
Pronouncement of a favorable judgment by the agent being referenced.
A URL to a page that describes the evidence that the learner met the criteria for attainment of the credential award.
The name of the agent issuing the award.
The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) from which the award was issued.
Usage Notes: Used only if an award is issued electronically for the achievement.

Definition: A statement or reference describing the evidence that the learner met the criteria for attainment of the achievement.
Usage Notes: A narrative that may connect multiple pieces of evidence OR an IRI or document describing the work that the recipient did to earn the achievement. This can be a page that links out to other pages if linking directly to the work is infeasible. May be used in an array of multiple values.

Definition: Indicates whether the credential has been revoked by the credential provider.
The date on which credential award was revoked.
Usage Notes: An empty string means the assertion was not revoked. Some uses (e.g. OpenBadges) may append time info in ISO 8601 format.

Definition: Published reason for revocation of a credential award.
The number of credits that a student can earn for enrolling in and completing a given course.
Use Case / Connection:
K-12 -> High School Generated Transcript
K-12 -> LEA-to-LEA Student Record Exchange
K-12 -> LEA-to-SEA Student Record Exchange
Format: Numeric - up to 2 digits after decimal place

Definition: The number of credits an individual earns by the successful completion of a course.
Use Case / Connection:
K-12 -> High School Feedback Report
K-12 -> High School Generated Transcript
K-12 -> LEA-to-LEA Student Record Exchange
K-12 -> LEA-to-SEA Student Record Exchange
Postsecondary Education -> Transition
Format: Numeric - up to 2 digits after decimal place

Definition: The URL to a document that includes a list of credential award assertions an issuer has revoked.
Change Notes: The DES v7.1 had "Credential Issuer Revocation List URL" under the PS domain. The correct place for the concept is under "Credential Award".
Usage Notes: See OpenBadges standard example http://openbadges.github.io/openbadges-specification/#RevocationList

Definition: Defines the revision of the competency framework as a version number or date.
Use Case / Connection: School Readiness

Definition: The default language of the text used for the content in the competency framework.
Change Notes: Updating to reflect the latest version of the ISO 639-2 standard.
Usage Notes: The CEDS ISO 639-2 Language Code option set comes from the ISO 639-2 standard, the character encoding in ISO 8859-1 download. Discontinued codes from the ISO standard are not included in the CEDS list.

Definition: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the competency framework.
The person or organization chiefly responsible for the intellectual content of the competency framework.
Usage Notes: Implementations may choose to model this element as a repeatable field to support the case of multiple authors. Others may just use a comma delimited string for multiple authors.

Definition: The date on which this content was first published.
Usage Notes: This may or may not be different from the Learning Standard Document Valid Start Date.

Definition: The publication status of the competency framework.
Option Set:
Adopted - Adopted
Draft - Draft
Published - Published
Deprecated - Deprecated
Unknown - Unknown

Definition: The entity responsible for making the competency framework available.
The information about rights held in and over the resource.
The person or organization owning or managing rights over the competency framework.
A URL that resolves to the original or authoritative competency framework document.
Change Notes: This new element "Competency Framework Source URL" aligns with concept in IMS CASE and ASN-DL. Definition adapted from ASN-DL property.
Usage Notes: This is the URL of a human-readable artifact. Often this document is published in html and/or pdf and is used by the standard setting entity as part of its approval process.

Definition: The globally unique identifier (GUID) issued by the publisher of the competency framework that uniquely identifies the definition in the hierarchy of competency definitions using a RFC 4122 compliant 32-character hexadecimal string, such as 21EC2020-3AEA-1069-A2DD-08002B30309D.
Use Case / Connection: School Readiness
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: CEDS "Identifier" elements reflect the intent of the XSD:Token format, i.e. a string in which carriage return, line feed, and tab characters have been removed as well as any internal sequences of two or more spaces and any leading or trailing spaces.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Identifier, Competency Item Identifier

Usage Notes: An Identifier MAY be a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) / Globally Unique Identifier (GUID), i.e.128-bit unique identifiers generated according to the algorithms and encoding standards of RFC 4122.

Definition: The text of the statement. The textual content that either describes a specific competency or describes a less granular group of competencies within the taxonomy of the competency framework.
Use Case / Connection: School Readiness
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: Note: This element is designed to support statements from various learning standards frameworks. The Head Start Child Outcomes Framework includes statements for Domains, Elements, and Indicators. Examples from the K-12 Common Core State Standards are the domain: “Geometry", the cluster: “Understand and apply the Pythagorean Theorem,” and standard: “Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to determine unknown side lengths in right triangles in real-world and mathematical problems in two and three dimensions.”
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Statement, Competency Item Statement

Definition: The unique identifier of an immediate prerequisite Competency Definition, a competency needed prior to learning this one. (Some items may have no prerequisites while others may have one or more prerequisites. This should only be used to represent the immediate predecessors in a competency-based pathway, i.e. not prerequisites of prerequisites.)
Use Case / Connection: School Readiness
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: The recommended approach is to use the entity Learning Standard Item Association instead of this data element. Learning Standard Item Association also supports associating other entities, such as Learning Resources, to learning standard items. CEDS "Identifier" elements reflect the intent of the XSD:Token format, i.e. a string in which carriage return, line feed, and tab characters have been removed as well as any internal sequences of two or more spaces and any leading or trailing spaces. An Identifier MAY be a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) / Globally Unique Identifier (GUID), i.e.128-bit unique identifiers generated according to the algorithms and encoding standards of RFC 4122.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Prerequisite Identifier, Competency Item Prerequisite Identifier

Definition: A network-resolvable Uniform Resource Locator (URL) pointing to the authoritative reference for the competency definition.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: An Identifier MAY be a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) / Globally Unique Identifier (GUID), i.e.128-bit unique identifiers generated according to the algorithms and encoding standards of RFC 4122.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item URL, Competency Item URL

Definition: A human-referenceable code designated by the publisher to identify the item in the hierarchy of competency definitions.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: For example: "M.1.N.3" The code is usually not globally unique and usually has embedded meaning such as a number that represents a grade/level and letters that represent content strands.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Code, Competency Item Code

Definition: The globally unique identifier (GUID) issued by the publisher of the competency framework that uniquely identifies the parent item in the hierarchy of competency definitions using a RFC 4122 compliant 32-character hexadecimal string, such as 21EC2020-3AEA-1069-A2DD-08002B30309D.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: CEDS "Identifier" elements reflect the intent of the XSD:Token format, i.e. a string in which carriage return, line feed, and tab characters have been removed as well as any internal sequences of two or more spaces and any leading or trailing spaces.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Parent Identifier, Competency Item Parent Identifier

Usage Notes: An Identifier MAY be a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) / Globally Unique Identifier (GUID), i.e.128-bit unique identifiers generated according to the algorithms and encoding standards of RFC 4122.

Definition: A human-referenceable code designated by the publisher to identify the parent item in the hierarchy of competency definitions.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Parent Code, Competency Item Parent Code

Definition: A network-resolvable Uniform Resource Locator (URL) pointing to the authoritative reference for the hierarchal parent of the competency definition.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Parent URL, Competency Item Parent URL

Definition: The education level, grade level or primary instructional level at which a Competency Definition is intended.
Option Set:
01043 - No school completed
00788 - Preschool
00805 - Kindergarten
00790 - First grade
00791 - Second grade
00792 - Third grade
00793 - Fourth grade
00794 - Fifth grade
00795 - Sixth grade
00796 - Seventh grade
00798 - Eighth grade
00799 - Ninth grade
00800 - Tenth grade
00801 - Eleventh Grade
01809 - 12th grade, no diploma
01044 - High school diploma
02408 - High school completers (e.g., certificate of attendance)
02409 - High school equivalency (e.g., GED)
00819 - Career and Technical Education certificate
00803 - Grade 13
01049 - Some college but no degree
01047 - Formal award, certificate or diploma (less than one year)
01048 - Formal award, certificate or diploma (more than or equal to one year)
01050 - Associate's degree (two years or more)
73063 - Adult education certification, endorsement, or degree
01051 - Bachelor's (Baccalaureate) degree
01054 - Master's degree (e.g., M.A., M.S., M. Eng., M.Ed., M.S.W., M.B.A., M.L.S.)
01055 - Specialist's degree (e.g., Ed.S.)
73081 - Post-master’s certificate
01052 - Graduate certificate
01057 - Doctoral (Doctor's) degree
01053 - First-professional degree
01056 - Post-professional degree
73082 - Doctor’s degree-research/scholarship
73083 - Doctor’s degree-professional practice
73084 - Doctor’s degree-other
73085 - Doctor’s degree-research/scholarship
09999 - Other
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: More than one Learning Standard Grade Level may be associated with one Learning Standard Item.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Education Level, Competency Item Education Level

Definition: Indicates that this is the most current version of the Competency Definition.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: This element supports version histories at the statement level. If corrections have been made to individual items/statements that are not part of a new Competency Framework, the elements 'Competency Definition Previous Version Identifier' and 'Competency Definition Current Version Indicator' provide a reference to historical versions of the current statement. In such uses the 'Competency Definition Code' could be the same for multiple versions of a statement and 'Competency Definition URL' could resolve to the most current version of the statement.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Current Version Indicator, Competency Item Current Version Indicator

Definition: The unique identifier of the previous version of the Competency Definition if the statement was modified.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: This element supports version histories at the statement level. If corrections have been made to individual items/statements that are not part of a new Competency Framework, the elements 'Competency Definition Previous Version Identifier' and 'Competency Definition Current Version Indicator' provide a reference to historical versions of the current statement. In such uses the 'Competency Definition Code' could be the same for multiple versions of a statement and 'Competency Definition URL' could resolve to the most current version of the statement.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Previous Version Identifier, Competency Item Previous Version Identifier

Usage Notes: CEDS "Identifier" elements reflect the intent of the XSD:Token format, i.e. a string in which carriage return, line feed, and tab characters have been removed as well as any internal sequences of two or more spaces and any leading or trailing spaces.

An Identifier MAY be a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) / Globally Unique Identifier (GUID), i.e.128-bit unique identifiers generated according to the algorithms and encoding standards of RFC 4122.

Definition: A label assigned by the publisher indicating the version of the competency framework statement.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Version, Competency Item Version

Definition: The class of statement in the structure of statements in the Competency Framework according to a controlled vocabulary, specified as a textual label.
Use Case / Connection: School Readiness
Change Notes: This updated definition and usage note for this element aligns with concept in the CEASN vocabulary. It provides a URL as a universal identifier for the type or class of the Competency Item. CEDS previously had the Competency Item Type element but not an element for specifying the URL that points to a definition of that type. It is based on ceasn:competencyCategory. Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: This property points to a class, not to instances of that class. For example, where two competencies in a competency framework have been identified respectively as \"Strand: Renaissance\" and \"Strand: Social history\", the competencyCategory for both these competencies is \"Strand\"."
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Type, Competency Item Type

Definition: The class of statement in the structure of statements in the Competency Framework according to a controlled vocabulary, specified as a URI referencing a controlled vocabulary.
Change Notes: This updated definition and usage note better aligns with concept in CEASN vocabulary. It provides a URL as a universal identifier for the type or class of the Competency Item. It is based on ceasn:competencyCategory. Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: This property points to a class, not to instances of that class. For example, where two competencies in a competency framework have been identified respectively as \"Strand: Renaissance\" and \"Strand: Social history\", the competency category for both these competencies is \"Strand\"."

Definition: Indicates if the competency described in the Competency Definition Statement can be tested using one or more assessment items.
Option Set:
SingleIndicator - Single Indicator
MultipleIndicator - Multiple Indicator
MultipleCompetency - Multiple Competency
CannotBeAssessed - Cannot be assessed
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Testability Type, Competency Item Testability Type

Definition: Classification of the Competency Definition using Bloom's Taxonomy Domains.
Option Set:
Cognitive - Cognitive
Affective - Affective
Psychomotor - Psychomotor
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Blooms Taxonomy Domain, Competency Item Blooms Taxonomy Domain

Definition: The significant topicality of the competency definition using free-text keywords and phrases.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Concept Keyword, Competency Item Concept Keyword

Definition: The topicality of the competency definition, e.g. "Pythagorean Theorem," "Trigonometric functions," "Forces and energy," "Scientific method," "Oral history," etc.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Concept Term, Competency Item Concept Term

Definition: The default language of the text used for the content in the competency definition statement.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person. Updating to reflect the latest version of the ISO 639-2 standard.
Usage Notes: The CEDS ISO 639-2 Language Code option set comes from the ISO 639-2 standard, the character encoding in ISO 8859-1 download. Discontinued codes from the ISO standard are not included in the CEDS list.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Language, Competency Item Language

Definition: The full text or URL reference to a legal document giving official permission to do something with the competency definition statement.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item License, Competency Item License

Definition: Classification of the Competency Definition using intelligences defined for Howard Earl Gardner's Theory of Multiple Intelligences.
Option Set:
Linguistic - Linguistic
Logic-mathematical - Logic-mathematical
Musical - Musical
Spatial - Spatial
BodilyKinesthetic - Bodily/kinesthetic
Interpersonal - Interpersonal
Intrapersonal - Intrapersonal
Naturalistic - Naturalistic
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Multiple Intelligence, Competency Item Multiple Intelligence

Definition: The name or label displayed on the node when this competency definition is used in a learning map.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Node Name, Competency Item Node Name

Definition: When the Competency Definition is used as a node in a learning map, this element supports alternative pathways based on a learner's accessibility profile. The type selected indicates which accessibility profile the node is designed to address.
Option Set:
Vision - Vision
Hearing - Hearing
Communication - Communication
Mobility - Mobility
General - General
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Node Accessibility Profile, Competency Item Node Accessibility Profile

Definition: Information about the derivation of a Competency Definition Statement.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Notes, Competency Item Notes

Definition: The scaling system used to specify the text complexity of a competency item.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Text Complexity System, Competency Item Text Complexity System

Element Name: Competency Definition Text Complexity Minimum Value
Definition: The minimum value in the range of text complexity applicable to a language competency definition using the scaling system defined by Text Complexity System, e.g. Lexile(tm).
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Text Complexity Minimum Value, Competency Item Text Complexity Minimum Value

Element Name: Competency Definition Text Complexity Maximum Value
Definition: The maximum value in the range of text complexity applicable to a language competency definition using the scaling system defined by Text Complexity System, e.g. Lexile(tm).
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Text Complexity Maximum Value, Competency Item Text Complexity Maximum Value

Definition: An unambiguous reference to the competency framework using a network-resolvable URI.
Use Case / Connection: School Readiness

Definition: A set of one or more alphanumeric characters and/or symbols denoting the positioning of the statement being described in a sequential listing of statements.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: Based on ASN's ListID. (add reference URL)
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Sequence, Competency Item Sequence

Element Name: Competency Definition Typical Age Range Maximum
Definition: The typical maximum age at which a person learns the defined competency.
Change Notes: This is one of two new elements that split the existing Competency Item Typical Age Range from a single element into separate elements for minimum and maximum values. The intent is to make the values machine readable without parsing.
Usage Notes: Use this element with "Competency Definition Typical Age Range Minimum" instead of "Competency Item Typical Age Range"

Element Name: Competency Definition Typical Age Range Minimum
Definition: The typical minimum age at which a person learns the defined competency.
Change Notes: This is one of two new elements that split the existing Competency Item Typical Age Range from a single element into separate elements for minimum and maximum values. The intent is to make the values machine readable without parsing.
Usage Notes: Use this element with "Competency Definition Typical Age Range Maximum" instead of "Competency Item Typical Age Range"

Definition: A URL that resolves to the original or authoritative competency framework document.
Change Notes: This new element "Competency Framework Source URL" aligns with concept in IMS CASE and ASN-DL. Definition adapted from ASN-DL property.
Usage Notes: This is the URL of a human-readable artifact. Often this document is published in html and/or pdf and is used by the standard setting entity as part of its approval process.

Definition: The year, month and day the competency definition was deprecated/replaced by the jurisdiction in which it was intended to apply.
Change Notes: Adding usage note to clarify that exit dates are inclusive, i.e. the dates represent the last day that the person was enrolled, participated, or received services, not the day after.
Usage Notes: When not specified, the entity is assumed to contain the most current version of the specified competency definition. All CEDS Exit and End Dates represent the last day of the date range specified, in this case the last day the competency definition was valid.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Valid End Date, Competency Item Valid End Date

Definition: The year, month and day the competency definition was adopted by the jurisdiction in which it was intended to apply.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Valid Start Date, Competency Item Valid Start Date

Definition: A URI that establishes uniqueness of an association between a competency definition and another competency item or other objects such as learning resources.
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Association Identifier URI

Definition: Defines the nature of the association between a Competency Definition and an associated data object such as a Learning Resource, an Assessment Item, or even another Competency Definition.
Option Set:
Prerequisite - Prerequisite
ConformsTo - Conforms To
Defines - Defines
HasFormat - Has Format
HasPart - Has Part
HasVersion - Has Version
IsAssessedBy - Is Assessed By
IsConformedTo - Is Conformed To
IsDefinedBy - Is Defined By
FormatOf - Is Format of
IsPartOf - Is Part Of
IsPrerequisiteTo - Is Prerequisite To
ReferencedBy - Is Referenced By
ReplacedBy - Is Replaced By
RequiredBy - Is Required By
IsTaughtBy - Is Taught By
VersionOf - Is Version Of
Referenced - Referenced
Assesses - Assesses
Teaches - Teaches
Requires - Requires
ComplexityLevel - Complexity Level
ReadingLevel - Reading Level
EducationalSubject - Educational Subject
EducationLevel - Education Level
Precedes - Precedes
Follows - Follows
IsConcurrentTo - Is Concurrent To
Change Notes: Entity name changed from "Competency Item" to "Competency Definition" to support alignment across standards and reduce confusion by those who might think this is a "competency assertion" that is attributed to a person rather than what it is, a definition of a competency that could apply to any person.
Usage Notes: The Learning Standard Item Association entity defines metadata relationships between a Learning Standard Item and other objects or relationships between Learning Standard Items not otherwise defined in the normal taxonomy of the framework such as for competency-based pathways, relationships between different versions of the same learning standard, and relationships to resources.

For example, "Prerequisite" may indicate that the Associated Learning Standard Item is a Prerequisite of this Learning Standards Item. Another association may specify that a Learning Resource "Teaches" the specified Learning Standard Item, or is aligned to the "Reading Level" specified as part of the Learning Standard Item.

Definition: Any citation appropriate to evidence the connection between nodes
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Association Connection Citation

Definition: Name of the destination node when the Competency Association is used as a connector in a learning map.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Association Destination Node Name

Definition: URI of the destination node when the Competency Association is used as a connector in a learning map.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Association Destination Node URI

Definition: Name of the origin node when the Competency Association is used as a connector in a learning map.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Association Origin Node Name

Definition: URI of the origin node when the Competency Association is used as a connector in a learning map.
Alternate Name: Learning Standard Item Association Origin Node URI

Definition: Indicates the relative significance this connection has for the destination node in a learning map.
Format: Numeric - up to 3 digits after decimal place
Usage Notes: This element is used to support learning maps and may be used in two ways 1) use a 1.000 to flag incoming nodes as important prerequisites/predecessors and 0.000 to indicate those with less significance, or 2) to indicate a levels of significance for the connection as a decimal between 0.000 and 1.000.

Definition: The criteria for the set of competencies that represent completion or partial completion of a unit, course, program, degree, certification, or other achievement/award. Specifies whether completion requires achievement of all items in the set or some number of items.
Usage Notes: The criteria may be ‘all’ competencies in the set or ‘at-least’ # of competencies. Sets may be nested, e.g. all in subset A and 3 of 5 from subset B.

Definition: The minimum number of competencies in the set that must be achieved for completion or partial completion of a unit, course, program, degree, certification, or other achievement/award.
Format: Integer - greater than or equal to 0
Usage Notes: Used to define the completion criteria when Competency Set Completion Criteria is "At Least". Not used when Competency Set Completion Criteria is "All".

Definition: The title of the resource.
The predominate type or kind characterizing the learning resource.
Option Set:
AlternateAssessment - Alternate Assessment
AssessmentItem - Assessment Item
Course - Course
DemonstrationSimulation - Demonstration/Simulation
EducatorCurriculumGuide - Educator/Curriculum Guide
FormativeAssessment - Formative assessment
ImagesVisuals - Images/Visuals
InterimSummativeAssessment - Interim/Summative Assessment
LearningActivity - Learning Activity
Lesson - Lesson
PrimarySource - Primary Source
RubricScoringGuide - Rubric/Scoring Guide
SelfAssessment - Self Assessment
Text - Text
Textbook - Textbook
Unit - Unit
Other - Other
Usage Notes: A community of SEAs have agreed to use a limited set of Learning Resource Type options when tagging learning resources in shared resource repositories. The options defined for this element align with those common tagging specifications.

Definition: A short description of the Learning Resource.
Defines the version of the learning resource as defined by the publisher.
The Uniform Resource Locator where the resource may be accessed, or a proxy for the resource, such as an information page for a commercially available resource.
The Uniform Resource Locator of a learning resource that is an adaptation for this resource.
URL identifier of a learning resource for which this resource is an adaptation.
A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources.
Usage Notes: Ex: “http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html“

Definition: Indicates that the learning resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility application programming interface (API).
Option Set:
AndroidAccessibility - Android Accessibility
ARIA - ARIA
ATK - ATK
AT-SPI - AT-SPI
BlackberryAccessibility - Blackberry Accessibility
iAccessible2 - I Accessible2
iOSAccessibility - iOS Accessibility
JavaAccessibility - Java Accessibility
MacOSXAccessibility - Mac OSX Accessibility
MSAA - MSAA
UIAutomation - UI Automation
Usage Notes: Options derive primarily from IMS Global's Access for All (AfA) specification, specifically: apiInteroperable.

Definition: A characteristic of the described learning resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users.
Option Set:
Flashing - Flashing
MotionSimulation - Motion simulation
Sound - Sound

Definition: An access mode through which the intellectual content of a described learning resource or adaptation is communicated; if adaptations for the resource are known, the access modes of those adaptations are not included.
Option Set:
auditory - Auditory
colorDependent - Color Dependent
tactile - Tactile
textOnImage - Text On Image
textual - Textual
visual - Visual
Usage Notes: Options derive primarily from IMS Global's Access for All (AfA) specification, specifically: AccessModeRequired.Type/existingAccessMode.

Definition: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that identifies the conditions that govern the user’s ability to access a learning resource.
